;美国总统乔·拜登的儿子亨特·拜登可能在会谈后因刑事指控接受审判新任命的美国特别检察官戴维·韦斯周五表示，潜在的认罪协议陷入僵局。

;

;不久前，美国司法部长梅里克·加兰提拔了一直处理该案的联邦检察官韦斯。将此案提升为特别检察官，这将赋予他继续调查的额外权力。

;

;国会共和党人威胁要对拜登从其 54 岁儿子的商业企业中受益这一未经证实的说法进行弹劾调查

;

;韦斯于六月对亨特·拜登提出轻罪刑事税收和枪支指控，双方达成了拟议的认罪协议。但一名联邦法官拒绝接受这笔交易。韦斯在周五的一份法庭文件中表示，双方陷入僵局，很可能会进行审判。

;

;亨特·拜登 (Hunter Joe) 7 月对未缴税款超过 150 万美元的指控表示无罪。检察官称，尽管欠款超过 10 万美元，但 2017 年和 2018 年的收入仍然很低。他没有在另一起案件中提出抗辩，该案件被指控在使用非法毒品的同时非法拥有枪支，这是一项重罪。

;

;亨特·拜登的审判可能会创造美国历史上前所未有的奇观：现任总统的儿子面临刑事指控，而他的父亲则在 2024 年竞选连任，可能是针对共和党人唐纳德·特朗普，后者自己也同时面临三项刑事审判。

;

;Weiss，最初被任命为美国总统特朗普担任特拉华州检察官，于2019年开始调查亨特·拜登。拜登执政期间，他被允许留任。他被任命为特别检察官使他比联邦检察官通常享有的独立性更大。

;

;韦斯表示，他可能会在华盛顿或加利福尼亚州对亨特·拜登提出不同的指控，这些地方被指控的犯罪行为发生在这些地方。亨特·拜登的律师没有立即回应置评请求。

;

;美国共和党高层麦卡锡考虑拜登弹劾调查

;

;加兰说，韦斯将在工作完成后提交一份报告，司法部将尽可能公开。

;

;“韦斯先生的任命向美国人民强化了司法部在特别敏感问题上对独立性和问责制的承诺，”加兰告诉新闻发布会。

;

;共和党人指责老拜登从他儿子在乌克兰和中国的商业活动中获利，尽管他们尚未提供任何不当行为的证据。众议院议长凯文·麦卡锡 (Kevin McCarthy) 7 月表示，众议院可能会在秋季启动弹劾调查。

;

;白宫拒绝置评。拜登官员此前曾驳斥共和党的指控，称其为“疯狂的阴谋论”，并表示拜登没有参与他儿子的商业事务。

;

;亨特·拜登曾担任说客、律师、顾问和投资银行家，并曾担任过游说者、律师、顾问和投资银行家。说他一直在与酗酒和吸食可卡因作斗争。

;

;共和党人表示韦斯缺乏继续调查的可信度。 “如果韦斯谈判的甜心交易无法获得批准，那么他作为特别顾问怎么能被信任呢？”麦卡锡说。

;

;韦斯是加兰任命的第三位处理政治敏感调查的准独立检察官。

;

;特别顾问杰克·史密斯已对特朗普提起两起刑事案件，其中一项指控他试图推翻他在 2020 年总统大选中输给拜登的事实，第二则指控他在离开白宫时不当携带敏感政府文件，并试图阻止官员取回这些文件。

;

;随着亨特·拜登达成认罪协议回顾他麻烦不断的过去

;

;另一位特别检察官罗伯特·胡尔(Robert Hur)正在调查拜登在2017年卸任副总统后是否对机密文件处理不当。

;

;亨特·拜登一直一位前同事告诉众议院监督委员会，亨特给人的印象是，近十年前他在乌克兰做生意时强调了他的家庭关系，而他的父亲则在乌克兰工作。副总统。

;

;证人德文·阿彻 (Devon Archer) 表示，亨特每天都与他的父亲交谈，但表示谈话不涉及商业交易。

;

;特朗普还经常提到年轻的拜登试图让他的父亲与两人在2024年总统选举中可能重赛。

;

;他的发言人张德良表示，韦斯应该“迅速得出结论”，拜登和他的儿子“应该面临必要的后果”。

;

;6 月份路透社/益普索 (Reuters/Ipsos) 的民意调查发现，一半的美国人，包括 75% 的共和党人和 33% 的民主党人，认为年轻的拜登从韦斯那里得到了优惠待遇。但大多数人表示这不会影响他们明年的投票。

;科技亿万富翁埃隆·马斯克，想要了解他计划与科技亿万富翁同行进行斗争的历史背景马斯克和 Facebook 创始人马克·扎克伯格已向意大利极右翼总理乔治亚·梅洛尼寻求地点。

;

;马斯克周五在他的在线平台 X（前身为 Twitter）上写道，他已与梅洛尼和她交谈过。文化部长根纳罗·桑朱利亚诺。

;

;“他们已经就一个史诗般的地点达成了一致，”他写道，但没有透露具体地点。

;

;他确实说过“相机画面中的一切都会是古罗马，所以根本就不是现代的”。

;

;那些猜测世界上最富有的两个人将像罗马斗兽场上的古代战士一样战斗的人应该三思。

;

; “这不会在罗马举行，”桑朱利亚诺说，并补充说他与马斯克进行了“长时间而友好的交谈”。

;

;“我们正在考虑如何组织一场伟大的慈善和历史活动，同时尊重并充分保护这些网站。”他说。

;

;马斯克在他的平台上写道，“这场斗争将由[他的]和扎克的基金会来管理”，他指的是 Facebook 的扎克伯格。梅洛尼的办公室周五没有做出初步评论。

;

;在斗兽场上刻下名字的游客表示，他不知道它是如此古老

;

;钱的去向似乎确实存在差异意大利文化部长表示，计划“向两家重要的意大利儿童医院捐赠数百万欧元的大笔资金”。

;

;马斯克在他的社交媒体网站上表示，“所有收益都将捐给退伍军人”。

;

;在马斯克向扎克伯格提出挑战并得到同意后，这场战斗的前景首次浮出水面。此后有很多媒体报道，但事情平静下来，所以很多人怀疑两人是否会在拳击场上见面。

;

;马斯克最近多次表示他想打架。

;

;他写道该活动将在他的服务 X 以及 Facebook 的母公司扎克伯格的 Meta 上进行现场直播。

;

;但是那些有兴趣看到两个中年男子用拳头而不是帖子或股价打斗的人会必须稍等一下。

;

;52 岁的马斯克需要对肩胛骨进行手术。他说，这让他的肋骨很痛，但他认为“恢复只需要几个月的时间”。

;一位挪威登山者最近成为登顶世界 14 座最高峰的最快人在批评者指责她跨过一名垂死的夏尔巴人以创造纪录后，她解决了争议。

;

;周四，37 岁的克里斯汀·哈里拉 (Kristin Harila) 在 Instagram 上发了一篇长篇帖子，表示她和她的团队“为他做了一切我们能做的事情”。

;

;Harila 和她的尼泊尔向导 Tenjin “Lama” Sherpa 在登上巴基斯坦喜马拉雅山脉的 K2 山顶后，于 7 月 27 日成为登顶世界上所有 14 座 8000 米高山最快的人。< /p>;

;他们在三个月零一天内完成了这一壮举，超越了尼泊尔出生的英国冒险家 Nirmal Purja 在 2019 年创造的六个月零六天的纪录。

;

;但无人机拍摄的视频在社交媒体上引发了争议其他登山者分享的照片显示，哈里拉的团队和其他人在一条狭窄而痛苦的通道上，跨过另一支团队倒下的夏尔巴人的尸体，该夏尔巴人后来在哈里拉的攀登过程中死亡。

;

;她还因庆祝自己的世界而受到批评那天晚上在大本营录制了唱片。

;

;“没有人会记住你在体育方面的成功，只有你的不人道，”一位评论家在 Instagram 上写道。

;

;“你的手上沾满了夏尔巴人的鲜血， ”另一位说。

;

;马来西亚登山者因没有感谢将他从珠穆朗玛峰救出的夏尔巴人而受到猛烈抨击

;

;哈里拉说，由于“所有错误信息，她觉得有必要说出自己的观点”以及现在正在蔓延的仇恨”，包括“死亡威胁”。

;

;她说，她、她的摄影师和另外两人“在瓶颈处花了 1.5 个小时试图把他拉上来”，指的是 27 年-老穆罕默德·哈桑。

;

;在前方维修小组发出求救信号后，她继续上升，将其他人与哈桑留在了后面。

;

;她的摄影师（仅被确认为加布里埃尔）也在其中。那些留在哈桑身边，与他分享氧气和热水的人，“当其他人经过时”。

;

;“考虑到留下来并转身的人数，我相信哈桑会得到一个小时后，加布里埃尔离开了，当时他需要“为了自己的安全而获得更多氧气”，她写道。当他追上哈里拉时，“我们知道他[哈桑]可能无法下来。”

;

;“这令人心碎。”

;

;在下降时，他们发现哈桑已经去世了。

;

;她的四人小组“无法安全地把他的尸体抬下来”，并指出至少需要六个人。

;

;他的死“确实是”悲惨......我对这个家庭感到非常强烈”，她说，但是“我们已经尽力了，尤其是加布里埃尔”。

;

;她指出哈桑“没有适当的装备来攀登”，没有穿着任何衣服羽绒服和手套。

;

;许多 Instagram 用户为 Harila 的行为辩护，并指出其中涉及的危险，而其他人则质疑为什么他的运营商没有为他配备更好的装备，其中一位用户讽刺地表示“当地的生活很便宜”。< /p>; Sat, 12 Aug 2023 00:50:02 +0800 For Paraguay and its new president, Taiwan ties are weighed against China’s potential economic rolehttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/article/3230855/paraguay-and-its-new-president-taiwan-ties-are-weighed-against-chinas-potential-economic-role?utm_source=rss_feed

;8 月 15 日，圣地亚哥·佩纳 (Santiago Peña) 走上洛斯洛佩斯宫前的舞台，接受总统腰带后，他不仅将就任巴拉圭领导人，还将正式领导这个仍然承认台湾主权的世界上最大的国家。

;

;这个拥有 680 万人口的南美国家，巩固了与台湾的外交关系。早在 1957 年，台湾就是一个自治岛屿，当时美国支持的阿尔弗雷多·斯特罗斯纳 (Alfredo Stroessner) 独裁统治，他是一位公开的反共主义者。

;

;而北京的领导层一直在稳步说服世界各国承认其对台湾的主权主张。多年来，巴拉圭一直坚定忠诚，利用台北的技术实力来推动新兴的电子市场。

;

;台湾一直在培育这种关系，向巴拉圭学校捐赠电脑，并为巴拉圭学校提供交换奖学金和语言课程。学生。执政的民进党 2024 年总统候选人、台湾副总统赖清德预计将出席佩尼亚的就职典礼，他计划在途中经停纽约和旧金山，北京将密切关注。

;<然而，尽管有这种情况，政府消息人士告诉《华盛顿邮报》，佩尼亚的亲密伙伴已表示需要重新评估长期立场，并考虑转向北京，而俄罗斯去年入侵乌克兰使这一情况变得更加复杂。

; >;

;巴拉圭国内政治中的这些暗流，使该国的牛肉行业与台湾的忠实支持者展开竞争，正在南方共同市场（亚松森所属的南美地区集团）围绕与北京关系的更大辩论中上演。

;<根据巴拉圭官方数据，到 2022 年，俄罗斯是亚松森牛肉的第二大买家，约占总销量的 20%。 2021 年，莫斯科在巴拉圭牛肉上花费了 3 亿美元，但战争和俄罗斯随后的金融孤立严重损害了销售。

;

;这些消息人士解释说，巴拉圭现在寻求进入美国牛肉市场，因为美国检查员正在评估该国的主要出口商。

;

;有关卫生法规和进口条款的谈判已经进行了近三年，而鉴于需要使其牛肉来源多样化并确保国内粮食安全，中国买家可能会更加灵活。< /p>;

;中国在拉美影响力的上升敲响了警钟：美国将军

;

;美国企业反对此举。 6 月，代表美国养牛业的 R-CALF 游说者敦促美国农业官员“立即撤回”他们允许从巴拉圭进口鲜肉的提案。

;

;该组织声称将巴拉圭牛肉引入美国。美国市场可能会在国内“造成不必要且可避免的口蹄疫传播风险”，同时“让消费者接触到来自未按照更严格生产标准饲养的牛的牛肉”。

;

;亚松森暗示旷日持久的谈判可能会促使他们重新考虑对北京的立场。

;

;2020年，巴拉圭牛肉生产商和出口商协会以及巴拉圭农村协会主张与中国建立关系，称可以提供经济生命线。

;

;台湾总统候选人赖清德在巴拉圭访问期间停留在美国

;

;即将卸任的总统马里奥·阿卜杜·贝尼特斯虽然不反对与北京进行贸易，但拒绝了关闭巴拉圭的想法巴拉圭驻华盛顿大使馆在回应《华盛顿邮报》询问时表示，巴拉圭和台湾有着超过 66 年不间断的外交关系。

;

;它描述了“一种纽带，通过从基础设施到公共卫生和教育等领域的贸易和合作，促进了两国关系的发展”，并“深刻塑造了两国之间非常积极的议程”。

;

;亚松森和台北“拥有共同的民主价值观和原则”大使馆发言人卢卡斯·斯特鲁宾 (Lucas Strübing) 补充道，他没有详细说明是否正在讨论与北京建立正式外交关系。

;

;驻华盛顿的台北经济文化代表处，它是台湾事实上的大使馆

;

;2020 年，来自左翼瓜苏阵线的七名巴拉圭反对派参议员提议与中国加强合作，关于是支持北京还是台北的问题达到了紧要关头。 ，引用了冠状病毒大流行期间该国医疗保健系统的“不稳定”状况。

;

;他们的立法倡议引起了强大的执政科罗拉多党的强烈抵制，并以 25 比 16 的投票结果失败。

;

; >;

;台湾问题也在巴拉圭总统竞选期间浮出水面。佩尼亚在贝尼特斯的支持下，以及他在台湾有广泛朋友网络的前学生经历的支持下，主张维持关系。

;

;参议员们对美国在拉美政策上输给中国表示遗憾

;

;主要反对派候选人、中左翼新巴拉圭联盟主席埃夫拉因·阿莱格里 (Efraín Alegre) 主张与北京建立更密切的关系，认为亚松森的利益被边缘化。

;

;佩尼亚赢得了总统竞选以43%的得票率轻松击败了获得27%选票的阿莱格里。尽管取得了决定性的胜利，但分析人士认为台湾难题还远未解决。

;

;瓜苏阵线国际关系总监里卡多·卡内塞 (Ricardo Canese) 形容科罗拉多党“长期以来从不受限制的台湾捐款和卡内斯表示，巴拉圭的现状阻碍了其利用大豆和牛肉出口、基础设施投资和工业现代化方面的“巨大机遇”。传统上支持科罗拉多党的经济精英付出了高昂的代价。

;

;“美国可能会迫使佩尼亚维持与台湾的关系，甚至违背强大的农产品出口商人的意见，”他补充道。

;

;中国希望与阿根廷建立“高质量的经济关系”

;

;这种压力可能会促使有影响力的支持者转向愿意促进与北京关系的其他政治团体，从而更好地服务卡内塞说，他们的直接经济利益。

;

;但华盛顿仍然可以打出一张引人注目的牌：对巴拉圭前总统、科罗拉多党高层人物奥拉西奥·卡特斯发出逮捕令。

;

;今年早些时候，美国对卡特斯实施制裁，指控他“通过腐败手段取得政治成功”。

;

;国际调查记者联盟的一项调查《潘多拉文件》在 2021 年提供了证据卡特斯如何利用离岸账户在佛罗里达州收购财产，逃避巴拉圭税务机关。

;

;此外，美国财政部官员指控卡特斯在 2013 年成功竞选总统期间向几名巴拉圭政客行贿。

;

;卡内斯表示，由于佩纳依赖卡特斯和美国的政治支持，“无法预测这种情况将如何结束”。

;

;在试图平衡不同的权力和利益时，佩尼亚可能会从南美国家乌拉圭的非正统做法中汲取灵感。

;

;

;

;

;2023年中国在美国拉美后院采取的5项贸易举措

;

;然而，南方共同市场其他成员对继续谈判的技术能力和政治意愿仍然存在严重怀疑。

;

;由于行业领袖之间没有达成共识，巴西和阿根廷尚未准备好与中国签署自由贸易协定乌拉圭天主教大学的伊格纳西奥·巴特萨吉 (Ignacio Bartesaghi) 表示，两国的工会和政治家都不愿意促成贸易协议，即使是在中国投资的情况下。

;

;而卢拉则提出了理由在与中国开始谈判之前缔结欧盟协议，“这是遏制乌拉圭双边谈判兴趣的一项战略”，巴特萨吉补充道。

;围绕巴拉圭不承认北京的不确定性可能会成为执行影响力的障碍智利天主教大学的弗朗西斯科·乌迪内斯 (Francisco Urdinez) 表示，他认为此类研究对于自由贸易协定的谈判至关重要。

;与中国达成的任何潜在协议都可能会遭到阿根廷附属机构的强烈抵制。圣保罗州工业联盟和工业联合会，其成员包括南美洲最著名的企业家。

;

;Bruna Santos，主任威尔逊中心巴西研究所的教授也对巴西向乌拉圭和巴拉圭做出让步表示怀疑。她表示，巴西利亚对国内再工业化有合理的担忧，并且吸引中国外国直接投资优先于自由贸易协定。

; Fri, 11 Aug 2023 23:50:01 +0800 China’s private firms facing persistent problem of overdue payments despite Beijing’s pledge to support key sectorhttps://www.scmp.com/economy/economic-indicators/article/3230810/chinas-private-firms-facing-persistent-problem-overdue-payments-despite-beijings-pledge-support-key?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.11 23:00;
;;

;审计报告显示，中国民营企业逾期付款问题愈加严峻和令人担忧来自几个主要经济省份的数据显示政府和国有企业欠下价值数十亿元人民币的债务。

;

;广东、江苏、河南等省份的审计报告显示，私营部门存在逾期债务，而私营部门是就业的主要来源和财政收入的贡献者。

;

;北京刚刚推出了多年来最强劲的出价，以支持超过 4700 万家注册私营企业（其中绝大多数是小型企业）和超过 1 亿个体户。

;

;“持续逾期” payments have been the norm at our company for years and there is hardly a solution,” said a business manager surnamed Yang at a state-owned firm in southwest China. Yang asked not to be identified due to the sensitivity of the issue.

;

;Yang's firm, which manufactures medical and health supplies and produces textile raw materials, has outstanding debts of several billion of yuan owed to dozens of private enterprises, including logistics firms and suppliers.

;

;Chinese businesses are facing the most prolonged payment delays among major Asian economies, according to a report released in July by global trade credit insurance group Coface.

;

;Triangular debt, a problem that first troubled China's economy over three decades ago, has resurfaced and is showing no sign of alleviation, posing a great challenge to the country's post-pandemic recovery.

;

;Triangular debt arises when delayed or partial payments leave companies owing money to each other and to banks. It discourages production and investment and the resulting liabilities or bad loans can put a damper on growth and exacerbate financial risks.

;

;More than 660 billion yuan (US$91.6 billion) of arrears were cleared by December 2019 after Beijing stressed the need to reduce overdue payments owed by local governments and state-owned enterprises (SOEs) in 2018.

;

;But it still remains a headache shared by business owners, and according to the annual audit report in the central Henan province, 9.563 billion yuan of overdue payments owed to private small- and medium-sized firms by local governments and SOEs were added last year.

;

;“The government has helped us with financing to alleviate the financial difficulties, but overall, the results have been minimal,” Yang added.

;

;His company has been unable to settle its debts having been hit by weak overseas demand, higher raw material prices and fierce market competition.

;

;Will new action plan give backbone of China's economy the wings to fly higher?

;

;The trade war between China and the United States, along with the global trend of reducing reliance on China, has led to a sharp decline in its export orders, with problems exacerbated during the coronavirus pandemic, with the company recording consecutive annual losses since 2020.

;

;While the private economy contributes over half of the country's tax revenue and more than 80 per cent of the urban workforce, profits by private companies with annual operating revenues of above 20 million yuan fell by 13.5 per cent in the first half of the year.

;

;Private sector fixed-asset investment also dropped by 0.2 per cent, year on year, in the first half of the year, while state-sector investment jumped by 8.1 per cent, official data showed.

;

;To invigorate the national economy, last month Beijing pledged to build the private economy “bigger, better and stronger”, with a new 31-point action plan offering solid political backing to create a favourable environment to unleash a more robust and fairer sector that underpins economic growth, jobs and technological innovation.

;

;China's top economic planner, the National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC), also doubled down on addressing delayed payments owed by the government and state-owned firms to small and medium-sized enterprises.

;

;To improve the government's credibility and performance mechanism, the NDRC said on Thursday that local governments considered untrustworthy will have their access to financial support from the central budget limited.

;

;But while private enterprises have publicly expressed optimism about Beijing's latest moves, they still harbour doubts, said Wang Qichang, an expert committee member at the Private Economy Research Centre in Zhejiang province.

;

;“Instead of chanting so many slogans and empty rhetoric, it would be better if tangible steps and concrete actions are taken,” he said.

;

;China seeks public feedback on challenges to building up private sector economy

;

;The main reason for the government's failure to repay its debts, he added, was reduced tax revenues following three years of stringent coronavirus prevention measures.

;

;“The private economy provides employment opportunities for society. With China's significant slump in exports, the operation of upstream and midstream industries is not favourable,” Wang said.

;

;“Without employment, there is no income, and without income, people have limited capacity for consumption. Without production, consumption, and trade, where will tax revenue come from?”

;

;He said China should persist with reform and opening up, otherwise the vicious cycle within China's economy would be difficult to break.

; Fri, 11 Aug 2023 23:20:02 +0800 Veteran Hong Kong nurse’s negligence contributed to blunder with premature baby who died after valve on device left closed: inquiryhttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/health-environment/article/3230856/veteran-hong-kong-nurses-negligence-contributed-blunder-premature-baby-who-died-after-valve-device?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.11 23:01;
;;

;A veteran nurse's negligence contributed to a fatal blunder involving a premature baby with heart problems who died in a Hong Kong hospital after a valve on an infusion line for medicine was not opened, an inquiry has found.

;

;In response to the findings, Prince of Wales Hospital in Sha Tin on Friday pledged to explore ways to improve the sensitivity of the alarm system for the injection device, which was responsible for delivering drugs to the patient.

;

;The nurse, who had more than 20 years of experience and worked in the neonatal intensive care unit for a long time, quit last month for personal reasons.

;

;Hong Kong hospitals 'should use tech to inspect facilities, increase checks'

;

;A hospital-appointed panel released the findings of its investigation two months after the premature newborn died in the intensive care unit 12 hours after a three-way valve controlling the flow of medicine was found to be closed.

;

;It said negligence, among “multiple factors”, was the cause that led to the blunder.

;

;“One of the nurses in charge did not open the valve so the medicine could not reach the infant. We think that inattentional blindness caused such negligence,” said Professor Fok Tai-fai, chairman of the Root Cause Analysis Panel.

;

;“The nurse did look at the valve, but did not realise it was closed.”

;

;Fok said the valve became “an unintentional blind spot” as the child was connected to a number of injection tubes and surrounded by many medical devices and an incubator.

;

;He said the attending nurse was “distracted” because she was “too nervous” about the concentration level of the medicine and did not open the valve after the injection.

;

;“The nurse kept asking another nurse if the concentration level was correct. They were then distracted and overlooked the closed valve,” he said.

;

;The hospital said the case was being processed by the Coroner's Court, which would determine the newborn's cause of death.

;

;The child, one of a set of twins, was born about two months premature on June 12 and sent to the intensive care unit after being diagnosed with congenital heart problems.

;

;The baby was placed on assisted ventilation and given inotropes, which help to control heart contractions, including adrenaline.

;

;Hong Kong medical experts caution against labelling infant's death as blunder

;

;When the infant's heart condition worsened, the nurse injected a more concentrated dose of adrenaline to raise the blood pressure at 3am on June 13. As the child's condition did not improve, two more doses were injected.

;

;The device's alarm went off 50 minutes later and the three-way valve controlling the flow of adrenaline was found to be closed. The infant died at 4pm the same day.

;

;Fok said another factor behind the incident was that the injection device's alarm was not sensitive enough to detect a blockage in the tube immediately.

;

;“The device has a limitation. When the amount of medicine is extremely small, it requires a long time to activate the alarm system,” he said.

;

;He added that the valve did not clearly indicate the liquid's direction of flow and the hospital could not find other valves with clearer indications on the market.

;

;Hong Kong hospital nurse injured by electric shock from faulty drug dispenser

;

;Hospital chief executive Dr Chung kin-lai on Friday reported that the other nurse and two doctors who were also responsible for treating the baby had returned to work after being put on leave.

;

;He pledged to look for three-way valves with better design, adding that the hospital had already shortened the time needed to activate the injection device's alarm system to the minimum 20 minutes.

;

;He said the hospital had revised its guidelines and added the requirement that medical staff should ensure the flow of medicine by “feeling” the tube's beginning to its end including the three-way valve with their hands.

;

;Medical officers had also been asked to include the checking of the tubes' patency in their usual double-checking procedure for high-alert medications and had been reminded about the limitation of injection devices.

;“The severity and scope of the executive order has certainly decreased from what we have thought in the beginning,” Da said.

;

;But Da said Raimondo would have to take some time to settle the issue during her trip.

;

;Beijing might still also have a tit-for-tat response to the order, he said.

;

;On the day of the announcement, the Chinese foreign ministry was quick to protest over the restrictions, labelling them “outright economic coercion and tech bullying” designed to “deprive China's development rights” in the name of national security.

;

;China's Ministry of Commerce also pledged to “preserve its own interest resolutely”, reserving its “rights to take actions”.

;

;US chip industry urges clear access to China market after Biden's tech order

;

;The areas covered by the order have been at the centre of tech rivalry between the two countries, with the US rolling out restrictions on the sale of advanced chips to China in October.

;

;In July, China retaliated by ordering export restrictions on two technology-critical materials, gallium and germanium and several of their compounds.

;

;Lu Xiaomeng, geo-technology director of Eurasia Group, said she expected China to respond to Wednesday's executive order with “some high-profile moves”.

;

;“Retaliation may take the form of unfavourable antitrust decisions on merger and acquisition deals involving US companies, or expansion of export control restrictions, among others,” Lu said.

;

;But the Chinese reaction was unlikely to be great enough to stop Raimondo's visit, she said.

;

;Yang Dali, a political economy professor at the University of Chicago, also expected trade talks to continue as China has shown a willingness to engage with the world economically again.

;

;A day after the executive order was announced, the Chinese government lifted its ban on group travel between China and 78 more countries, including the US. The restriction was imposed three years ago to limit the spread of Covid-19.

;

;“That is an indication clearly China feels like it needs to reach out, [and] it needs to have the open door again,” Yang said.

;

;He agreed that – from China's perspective – the tech investment bans were a setback to their normalisation of ties but the outcome to be mediated.

;

;“[I think] part of the effort for the leadership in Beijing to receive American officials from the secretary [of state] and then to others, is part of an effort to try to narrow down or defuse this particular order in a way,” Yang said, adding the meetings “did help” to delimit the final restrictions.

;

;But there are other uncertainties.

;

;When US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen visited China, they were received by then-foreign minister Qin Gang, who was suddenly removed in July without official explanation.

;

;Yang said the sudden replacement of the foreign minister was “disruptive” to the US-China communication and it was unclear how long Wang Yi, who replaced Qin, would be in office.

;

;“The biggest thing is really whether President Xi Jinping would be at the Apec meeting in the US [in November] and whether there would be a meeting between him and President Biden,” Yang said.

;

;“If that happens, clearly, all the setbacks over the last few months would have more or less been decided [by both sides] to put them aside a little bit … but I'm pretty sure some of the terms or phrases by President Biden also do get to China as well.”

;

;Biden referred to Xi as a “dictator” in June and this week called China a “ticking time bomb” because of its economic challenges.

;

;There are also tensions over Taiwan.

;

;The US last month approved a US$345 million landmark military aid package for the self-ruled island, which Beijing regards as interference to its domestic affairs.

;

;Shi Yinhong, an international relations professor at Renmin University in Beijing, said major changes through high-level dialogue were unlikely.

;

;The coexistence of competition and confrontation – a traditional portrayal of US-China relations – “has become a very untimely and inappropriate proposition because the former part of that description has overwhelmingly exceeded the latter part in recent years”, he said.

;

;Shen Dingli, a Shanghai-based international relations researcher, said there could be a silver lining to the order in the long run.

;

;“If China does not owe the US [in terms of technological advancement] … the two countries could walk their own path and avoid entangling interests,” he said.

;

;India's government unveiled new punishments for mob lynchings and crimes against women on Friday in a proposal for the country's biggest criminal justice overhaul since the British colonial era.

;

;India's Penal Code and other statutes governing the police and courts were introduced in the 19th century, while the country was governed by the British crown.

;

;Sweeping changes to the laws would remove archaic references to the British monarchy and other “signs of our slavery”, home minister Amit Shah told parliament on Friday.

;

;“These laws were made to strengthen the colonial rule, to protect colonial rulers, and the intention was to punish and not give justice,” he told lawmakers while introducing bills for the reforms.

;

;“We are going to change this and the spirit of these new laws will be to protect the constitutional rights of our citizens.”

;

;India's top court declares same-sex couples entitled to social benefits

;

;New provisions in the laws would impose the death penalty on perpetrators of mob lynchings and minimum sentences of 20 years for gang rape.

;

;The bills also introduce community service provisions for petty crimes to ease the chronic backlog of criminal cases in Indian courts, which have millions of pending cases.

;

;Fixed timelines would be imposed for trials and criminal investigations in a country where both can drag on for years without result.

;

;The bills have been referred to a parliamentary committee for further deliberation but could be passed before the current legislature dissolves ahead of general elections next May.

;

;Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Hindu-nationalist government has sought to remove lingering symbols of colonial rule from India's history books, urban landscape and political institutions.

;

;It has renovated the capital New Delhi's parliamentary precinct, originally designed by the British, to replace old colonial-era structures.

;

;Last year Modi inaugurated a statue of Subhas Chandra Bose, an independence hero venerated for taking up arms against the British, but controversial for his collaboration with Nazi Germany's war machine.

;

;The unveiling ceremony took place just hours before Britain announced the death of Queen Elizabeth II, and the statue itself replaces one of Britain's King George V torn down nearly half a century ago.

;Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday dismissed officials responsible for military conscription in each region of the country, citing corruption allegations that he said could amount to treason.

;

;“We are dismissing all regional military commissars,” Zelensky said in a post on social media, following a meeting with senior military leadership.

;

;“This system should be run by people who know exactly what war is and why cynicism and bribery at a time of war is high treason,” he added.

;

;Kyiv has been conscripting Ukrainians for assault battalions for its counteroffensive against Russian forces to recapture territory controlled by Moscow's troops.

;

;The move reflects Ukraine's efforts to clamp down on corruption and corruption as part of sweeping reforms requested by Western institutions like the European Union, which Ukraine hopes to join.

;

;Ukraine says it foiled Zelensky assassination plot, detained woman informant

;

;“During the inspection of the territorial recruitment centres, law enforcement agencies exposed cases of corruption,” the presidency said in a separate statement.

;

;It said Ukraine's general mobilisation was a key area in which inspectors had uncovered instances of foul play.

;

;These “pose a threat to Ukraine's national security and undermine confidence in state institutions,” the statement said.

;

;It added that Ukraine's Security Council recommended that the head of the army select replacements who have battlefield experience and were vetted by Ukraine's intelligence services.

;

;Russia attacked the western Ukrainian region of Ivano-Frankivsk with hypersonic missiles on Friday, hitting areas near a military airfield and killing an eight-year-old boy, Ukrainian officials said.

;

;One missile crashed into the grounds of a family's home in the Kolomyia district, wounding several people including the boy, who later died in hospital, regional governor Svitlana Onyshchuk said.

;

;“Medics did everything possible, but unfortunately the child's life could not be saved,” she wrote on the Telegram messaging app without clarifying how many people had been hurt.

;

;Air defences shot down one of the four Kinzhal missiles near the capital Kyiv as they hurtled towards western Ukraine hundreds of miles from the front, the air force said.

;

;“One X-47 [hypersonic] missile was destroyed within Kyiv region.其余的袭击在机场附近。 Civilian infrastructure was damaged, and one of the missiles hit a residential area,” it said on Telegram.

;

;Air Force Colonel Yuriy Ihnat suggested the attack had been aimed at Ukrainian pilots who were about to travel to the West to train to use F-16 fighter jets that Kyiv hopes will eventually be delivered.

;

;“They [the pilots] will be trained on new equipment – the F-16 – and the enemy wanted to strike our young people, depriving us of the prospect of using the new Western equipment,” he said on television.

;

;In Kyiv's northern Obolon district, missile fragments crashed into the grounds of a children's hospital, damaged the roof of a house and also fell on a complex of country homes. Mayor Vitali Klitschko reported no casualties.

;

;Witnesses in the city centre said they heard two loud explosions, but could not tell where they were coming from.

;

;“We should thank our air defence forces for shooting down the missiles,” Mykhailo Shamanov, a city official, said on television shortly after the strike.

;

;Officials said that air defences had also been at work in the western region of Khmelnytskyi where media reports said explosions had been heard. There were no reports of damage or casualties.

;

;Ukraine's Black Sea drone attacks signal a rapidly expanding war

;

;Authorities issued a nationwide air alert before the attack, and social media monitors reported that several Russian warplanes that carry long-range missiles had taken off from Russian air bases.

;

;The West has supplied sophisticated air defence systems to Ukraine to help defend itself from regular waves of Russian missile and drone strikes.

;

;Those air defences have allowed Kyiv to fend off the full brunt of Russia's air strikes in recent months, but other areas of Ukraine, a country double the size of Italy, are more thinly protected.

;

;Russia has struck Ukrainian cities far from the front lines throughout its war, often hitting civilian targets. Moscow denies intentionally targeting civilians.
